title: Six injured in two separate shootings
content:
Six people were shot in two separate shootings on Friday and Saturday in Kankakee.
One person was injured in a shooting in the 900 block of East Mulberry Street earlier today, police said.
Five people were injured Friday night after two shooters began firing at a group of people in the 300 block of North Wildwood Avenue at around 10 p.m.
Police said the shootings were not related and that none of the victims or witnesses were cooperating.
A 24-year-old Kankakee man was shot Monday following a dispute with a man in the 300 block of South Wildwood Avenue.
Johnny B. Johnson, 22, was arrested and charged with aggravated battery with a firearm for that shooting.
Prior to Monday's shooting, Kankakee police investigated 15 non-fatal shootings this year. One of those was a self-inflicted shooting.
